title: Queue Page Merge Queue Display
description:
## Context

The Queue page at `/queue` should show the merge queue status from refinery.

## Data Sources

The gt dashboard fetches PRs via gh CLI:
```bash
gh pr list --repo <repo> --state open --json number,title,url,mergeable,statusCheckRollup
```

For local merge queue, check bd for merge_request type issues or refinery mail.

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/queue/+page.server.ts`
2. Fetch open PRs or merge queue items
3. Use QueueLayout component (already exists)
4. Show: PR number, title, CI status, mergeable status
5. Color code: green (ready), yellow (pending), red (conflict/fail)

## Simplified Approach

For MVP, just show a summary:
- Number of items in queue
- List any open issues with type=merge_request

```bash
bd list --type=merge_request --status=open --json
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Queue page shows merge queue status
- [ ] Items display with title and status
- [ ] Color coding for status
- [ ] Empty state when queue is empty
- [ ] Error handling for failed fetches
close_reason: Queue page now fetches real merge queue data via bd list. Shows empty state, color-coded status indicators.

title: Agent Detail Page
description:
## Context

The Agent Detail page at `/agents/[id]` is a placeholder. Show detailed info for a specific agent.

## Data Sources

1. `gt status --json` - Get agent list, find by id
2. `gt peek <agent>` - Get recent output from agent's tmux session
3. `gt mail inbox --actor=<agent>` - Get agent's unread mail (optional)

## Agent ID Format

The `[id]` param will be the agent's session name or address:
- Infrastructure: `hq-mayor`, `hq-deacon`
- Rig agents: `gastown_ui-witness`, `gastown_ui-refinery`
- Polecats: `gastown_ui-polecat-furiosa`

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/agents/[id]/+page.server.ts`
2. Parse id param to find agent in gt status output
3. Optionally call gt peek for recent activity
4. Use AgentDetailLayout component (already exists)
5. Show: name, role, status, current work, recent output

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Detail page loads for valid agent IDs
- [ ] Shows agent name, role, status
- [ ] Shows current hook/work if any
- [ ] Shows recent activity (from gt peek if available)
- [ ] 404 for invalid agent IDs
- [ ] Back link to /agents

title: Logs Page Live Streaming
description:
## Context

The Logs page at `/logs` should show Gas Town events from the event feed.

## Data Sources

Event files in town root:
- `.events.jsonl` - Structured events (agent starts, completions, errors)
- `.feed.jsonl` - Activity feed

Format: One JSON object per line with timestamp, type, actor, details.

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/logs/+page.server.ts` to read recent events
2. Parse JSONL and return as array
3. Use LogsLayout and LogEntry components (already exist)
4. Show timestamp, event type, actor, message
5. Limit to last 100 events initially
6. Optional: Add filter by type or actor

## Technical Notes

```typescript
// Read JSONL file
import { readFileSync } from 'fs';
const lines = readFileSync('.events.jsonl', 'utf-8').split('\n').filter(Boolean);
const events = lines.map(line => JSON.parse(line));
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Logs page shows real events from .events.jsonl
- [ ] Events display with timestamp and type
- [ ] Most recent events first
- [ ] Handles empty file gracefully
- [ ] Error state if file unreadable
close_reason: Implemented logs page with live streaming from .events.jsonl

title: Dashboard Data Integration
description:
## Context

The `gt dashboard` command (see `/Users/amrit/Documents/Projects/Rust/mouchak/gastown/internal/web/`) already provides a web dashboard at :8080. We need to connect our SvelteKit UI to the same data sources.

## Data Sources

1. **`gt status --json`** - Returns full workspace status:
   - `agents[]` - mayor, deacon with running/state/unread_mail
   - `rigs[]` - each rig with polecats[], has_witness, has_refinery, hooks[]
   - `overseer` - name, email, unread_mail

2. **`bd list --type=convoy --status=open --json`** - Convoy tracking

3. **`tmux list-sessions -F "#{session_name}|#{session_activity}"`** - Live agent activity

## Existing Components

- `DashboardLayout` - main layout with stats slots
- `AgentCard` - displays agent with name, task, status, progress, meta
- `GridPattern` - background decoration

## Files Started (review and complete)

- `src/routes/+page.server.ts` - server load calling gt status --json
- `src/routes/api/gastown/status/+server.ts` - API endpoint
- `src/routes/api/gastown/convoys/+server.ts` - API endpoint

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Dashboard shows real agents from `gt status --json`
- [ ] Stats show real counts (active agents, tasks running)
- [ ] AgentCard displays: name, current task/state, running/idle/error status
- [ ] Page refreshes data on load (SSR)
- [ ] Error state shown if gt command fails
- [ ] Remove all mock/hardcoded data from +page.svelte
close_reason: Dashboard data integration complete. Real agents displayed from gt status --json.

title: Agents Page Real-time Updates
description:
## Context

The Agents page at `/agents` currently shows hardcoded mock data. Connect it to real Gas Town data.

## Data Source

`gt status --json` returns:
```json
{
  "agents": [
    {"name": "mayor", "address": "mayor/", "session": "hq-mayor", "role": "coordinator", "running": true, "has_work": false, "state": "idle", "unread_mail": 2}
  ],
  "rigs": [
    {
      "name": "gastown_ui",
      "polecats": ["furiosa"],
      "has_witness": true,
      "has_refinery": true,
      "hooks": [{"agent": "gastown_ui/furiosa", "role": "polecat", "has_work": true, "bead_id": "gt-e81"}]
    }
  ]
}
```

## Existing Components

- `AgentCard` - props: name, task, status (running|idle|error|stopped), progress, meta
- `GridPattern` - background decoration
- Current page: `src/routes/agents/+page.svelte`

## Requirements

1. Create `src/routes/agents/+page.server.ts` that calls `gt status --json`
2. Transform agents + rig polecats into AgentCard format
3. Update `+page.svelte` to use data from load function
4. Show agent address as meta (e.g., "gastown_ui/polecats/furiosa")
5. Link each card to `/agents/[id]` detail page
6. Remove all mock data

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Agents page shows real agents from gt status
- [ ] Infrastructure agents (mayor, deacon) appear
- [ ] Rig agents (witness, refinery) appear per rig
- [ ] Polecats appear with their current work status
- [ ] Cards link to detail pages
- [ ] Error state if gt command fails
close_reason: Implemented: +page.server.ts calls gt status --json, +page.svelte uses load data
